reporter_caption.center: KUPPERSMITH v. SOUTH ALABAMA SEAFOOD, 627 So.2d 407 (Ala.Civ.App. 1993)

caption.center: Oliver F. KUPPERSMITH and Lindon C. Johnson v. SOUTH ALABAMA SEAFOOD

court.center: Court of Civil Appeals of Alabama.

opinion.posture: Appeal from Montgomery Circuit Court; Joseph D. Phelps, Judge.Page 408
opinion.attorneys:
Algert S. Agricola, Jr., Montgomery, for appellants.
Richard G. Alexander of Alexander Associates, and Donald F. Pierce, Forrest S. Latta and Pamela K. Millsaps of Pierce, Carr Alford, P.C., Mobile, for appellees.

opinion_text.center: AFTER REMAND FROM THE SUPREME COURT

opinion.opinion_text:
The prior judgment of this court has been reversed, and the cause remanded by the Supreme Court of Alabama. On remand to this court, and in compliance with the Supreme Court's opinion of August 6, 1993, 627 So.2d 406 (Ala. 1993), the judgment of the trial court is now affirmed.
AFFIRMED.
All the Judges concur.
